Hi,

I'm pretty new to JUnit testing and I'm having a question regarding wr=
iting a test for the example class beneath which e.g. use XPath to query an=
 xml file and returns an object if it's found.

Assume i have the following=
 class

public Class A
{
   
  public Object executeXPath (String filename,=
 String xPath)
 { 
   Object objectA =3D null
   ...
   try
    {
      XPa=
thExpression expr =3D xpath.compile(xPath); // Send a false xPath string in=
to here (resulint in the exception)
      ...
    }
    catch (XPathExpress=
ionException e)
    {
       ....
    }

    return objectA;
 }


Now I hav=
e following questions:

Is it neccesary to write a test for the catch block=
 or is it enough to write a test to check if in such a case the return obje=
ct is null  ?

If it's necessary to write a test how does this test needs t=
o look ?

Tnx in advance for the feedback.

Regards,
Tom

}
